meanings.definition: To cheat or swindle by overcharging or raising the price after agreeing on a lower one.
meanings.sent1: The sneaky seller tried to gazump the unsuspecting buyer by increasing the price at the last minute.
meanings.sent2: She felt cheated when the seller decided to gazump her by asking for more money than they had agreed upon.
meanings.sent3: The seller's attempt to gazump the buyer backfired when the buyer walked away from the deal.
meanings.sent4: The landlord's decision to gazump the tenants left a sour taste in everyone's mouth.
meanings.sent5: The practice of gazumping is frowned upon in fair business transactions.

meanings.definition: To outbid someone on a property after already agreeing to a lower price.
meanings.sent1: The cunning bidder managed to gazump his competitor by offering a higher price at the last moment.
meanings.sent2: They were shocked when the other buyer tried to gazump them by bidding more than the agreed-upon amount.
meanings.sent3: The real estate agent joked that he would gazump his own clients if they didn't make a decision soon.
meanings.sent4: The auction turned intense as the bidders tried to gazump each other to secure the property.
meanings.sent5: In the world of auctions, it's common for buyers to try and gazump each other to win the bid.
